main event: On 9 January 1953, multiple unidentified flying objects were observed over Suwon, Korea by military personnel for varying durations.
interesting points: The first sighting involved an object described as round and silver, approximately 30-40 feet in diameter, flying at an estimated speed of 400-500 knots and maintained altitude and speed,The sighting lasted about 10 minutes with no sound heard,At least four military personnel confirmed the sighting at Suwon Air Base,The second sighting involved an object described as circular and metallic, appearing at 25,000 feet, observed for 2 minutes before it suddenly turned and climbed rapidly,Tracking attempts with searchlights and radio contact were unsuccessful.
witness description: military personnel, including a Warrant Officer and several Airmen
